instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan
threads.message:
Arrived with GPU issues. Replaced GPU but fans spin fast and runs slow.

Ran ASD and TC0C digital core SMC IO failure appeared. <RESISTOR>R4910</RESISTOR> measured exactly 43

What should be checked next? Board looks spotless

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan
threads.message: There is not a lot to check with <SIGNAL>CPU_PECI</SIGNAL>. Ensure traces are intact, also <RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5223</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan
threads.message:
Before replacing GPU, fan was working normally?
If yes, something happened in the process; checked for moved components near the BGA chip, or in the opposite side.
Can also be a bad chip, or solders.
